column2:
Anoint a strong Amazon, so that she may prepare herself to take charge of a province. 

 ----------------

 To grant titles to a new holder as an Amazon you need to first tag the selected character through this decision, then right click on the title you wish to give away to complete the process before the assigned modifier tag runs out.

Entrust the protection of this province to your chosen Amazon.

----------------

  Once you've tagged an Amazon through character decision, pick this decision to grant him this title.

Rigg teaches Amazons to be fierce and ruthelss, that is the only way for a woman to survive and be free. If [Root.GetFirstName] has grown complacent, there is only one way to have her find again her spirit or die trying.

Invite your sisters to a great tournament organized to celebrate strength and skill in fighting and thus please the Goddesses of War. Be sure to have enough young, able-bodied Amazons in your court and amongst your vassals before issuing this command, since, if there are not enough participants willing to fight, you won't be able to issue another tournament for a few years.

The eternal cycle ensuring the survival of Athel Loren must be preserved. The gods will protect the forests, as long as there are volunteers amongst the Asrai to become their vessels. You currently claim rule over Athel Loren, yet have refused thus far such burden.

The eternal cycle ensuring the survival of Athel Loren must be preserved. The Gods will protect the forests, as long as there are volunteers amongst the Asrai to become their vessels. You currently bear such burden, yet your spouse is still free from it. For balance to be reached, Isha and Kurnous must be reunited.
Offer a sacrifice in order to appease the capricious spirits of Athel Loren.
You lead several of the spirits of Athel Loren, call for their help in your battle.
You have a direct link with the mysterious forces governing Athel Loren. You can use it to call for a spirit host.
Children caught in the clutches of the Fair Folk are known to have disappeared in the depths of Athel Loren.
Asrai are fickle and mysterious beings with little regard for the treaties and requirements of other lesser kins. If they deem it necessary, they can just intercede in any conflict they please.
The Asrai Spellsingers are known to use their connection to the forest to move in mysterious ways.
Restore the sanctity of Athel Loren by cleansing it from the deviant constructions laid down by the barbaric settlers.
You could take your ward [Root.GetFirstName] as an apprentice and teach [Root.GetHerHim] to connect to the Weave.
It is tradition for the Phoenix King to be legitimized by crossing Asuryan's holy flames. If the Prince emerges unscathed, then he is recognized as the rightful ruler of the Asur.
Asuryan has cursed you, is it really worth it to worship a God who despises your rule?
Ulthuan faces a great invasion, I should join the defence!
Every Elf in Ulthuan has their personal opinion about whether Asur should involve themselves in the affairs of the outside world or not. What's yours?
As Phoenix King, you are allowed to switch the foreign policy of Ulthuan depending on your preference.
Give a share of your profits to the ancestral homeland, so that the Phoenix King may look kindly upon you in your time of need.
As an Asuryan colony, you can plead to the Phoenix King for help in any war against barbarians you find yourself entangled in.
You can assist your brethren abroad by joining in their struggles against lesser races.
Ulthuan's borders are currently closed. A generous donation from a legitimate source could perhaps change the Phoenix King's mind?
Avelorn is traditionally held by the holy Everqueen. As the Phoenix King you can force the current holder to relinquish it back to its rightful owner.
Asur nobles are used to endlessly debating over the vital role Ulthuan should have in the grand scheme of things.
Challenge your liege for supremacy over the Herds.
The prisoners from the last raid will be disposed of in the manner you prefer.
The call of the Corrupter is strong. You can join Morghur in his quest to destroy the pitiful Elves of Athel Loren.
[Root.GetFirstName] is your prisoner. Eating [Root.GetHerHim] could be a good way to set an example for the herd.
Issue a great offering to the gods beneath the herdstone, increasing your renown and draw more warriors under your banner.
Issue a great offering to the gods beneath the herdstone, increasing your renown and draw more warriors under your banner.
You can levy most of your farmers to help with your lack of soldiers, but it will have negative effects on the province as a whole.
Let us hold a tournament the like of which is only rumoured. All Knights and Lords of the realm will gather at [Root.Capital.GetName]
column3: Permettez-nous d'organiser un tournoi comme nul pareil. Tous les Chevaliers et les Seigneurs du Royaume se rassembleront à [Root.Capital.GetName].
column6: Organizaremos un Torneo que será recordado hasta el fin de los dias.  Todos los caballeros y Lords del Reino se daran cita en [Root.Capital.GetName]

column2: Let us hold a jousting tournament for the Knights and Lords of our region in [Root.Capital.GetName]
column3: Permettez-nous d'organiser une joute pour les Chevaliers et Seigneurs de notre région à [Root.Capital.GetName].
column6: Organizaremos un Torneo en el que se daran cita los caballeros y Lords de la región en [Root.Capital.GetName]

column2: Let us hold a small tournament for local Knights and Lords in [Root.Capital.GetName]
column3: Permettez-nous d'organiser un tournoi pour les Chevaliers et les Lords des environs à [Root.Capital.GetName].
column6: Organizaremos un Torneo en el que se daran cita los caballero y Lords locales

column3: Voir les vainqueurs de médailles dans des tournois.
column6: Ver los medalleros de los torneos

column3: Voir les vainqueurs de médailles dans des tournois.
column6: Ver los medalleros de los torneos

column2: Feed this prisoner to your favourite cold one.
Feed this prisoner to your dragon.
Feed this prisoner to your griffon.

Ulthuan is your ancestral birthright. The time has now come to return and reclaim it from those who once drove your people out. Once you've made up your mind, you'll organize a great invasion in the next two years, during which you'll be able to wage war against Ulthuan at any time.
Ask around to see who is amongst the most favourite of the current members of the Cabal.
Retract your support to [Root.GetTitledFirstName]'s claim on Ghrond. You can still decide to support [Root.GetHerHim] later.
Support [Root.GetFirstName] as the next elected ruler of Ghrond's Cabal of practitioners of the Dark Arts. You can always decide to retract your vote later.

As the long reigning ruler of Naggaroth, you've had years to create your own network of spies and seers to find and take care of any dissidents within your realm. With a single order you can make sure there will be no more factioneering against you for some time.
A Black Dragon egg consumed gives its eater a portion of its strength, increasing their physical prowess.
A Black Dragon would make a mighty mount indeed. By acquiring an egg, you eventually acquire one for yourself. Alternatively, it could be eaten to gain a portion of the dragon's power.
I've come into the possession of a black dragon egg. I should decide what to do with it.
I've come into possession of a Black Dragon Hatchling. I should decide what to do with it.
As High King, legitimate or not, you can persuade other Dawi to join your High Kingdom.
Learn how to build everything from buildings to statues, over the next hundred years.

Return the splendour and magnificence of the hammerers that they deserve to have. By giving them their own headquarters, they will recruit new hammerers from the elites of the elites within your ranks.
Go tunneling, discovering what there is to find underground.
Return from your tunneling towards your hold.
Call in the Council of Kings to declare yourself candidate for seat of the High King and call the moot to decide on the matter to vote.
This character goes into seclusion, delving deep into his engineering knowledge...
Return from your studies early and end regency.
You may demand [Root.GetBestName] to compensate for his Grudge against Clan [From.GetOnlyDynastyName].
In [Root.Capital.GetName]'s Book of Grudges are listed all Grudges against Clan [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName].

column3: Faire appel à de fervents guerriers

column2: When the time comes, every Dwarf must and will take up weapons in order to defend their hold. Push these kruti back!
column3: Grâce à votre réputation de servir fidèlement [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName], vous pouvez faire appel à une bande de fervents guerriers pour défendre votre pays contre les infidèles.
column4: Aufgrund Eures Rufs als ergebener Diener von [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] habt Ihr die Möglichkeit, eine Gruppe ergebener Krieger zur Verteidigung Eures Reiches gegen die Heiden herbeizurufen.
column6: Gracias a tu reputación como fiel servidor de [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName], puedes llamar a una banda de guerreros devotos para ayudarte a defender el reino contra los infieles.

column2: Recommission a suit of Gromril Armour
In your armory you have a number of fine suits of Gromril Armour. Although it will be expensive, you could hire a Runesmith to recommission one of them.
Recommission a suit of Royal Gromril Armour
In your armory you have many suits of Gromril Armour, and some of them are exceptionally fine. If you're prepared to pay the cost, a Master Runesmith could recommission one of them for you.
Refit a suit of Ancient Gromril Armour

In your vast arsenal even Gromril is abundant, but your smiths have discovered a truly miraculous suit of armour from a bygone age. How much longer will you go without protection befitting your station?
I am da [Root.GetTitle] of dis 'ere tribe, 'an you's do as I say!
Dis 'ere boy [Root.GetBestName] wud make da [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] clan stronga!. Note that you can only have a total of 3 adopted heirs, living or dead.
OI! I'z da biggest, meanest warboss 'dere iz! \nThis decision will upgrade your primary King title into a titular Empire.
OI! I'z a big bad warboss ya git! \nThis decision will upgrade your primary Duke title into a titular Kingdom.

Declaring a WAAAGH! against a target gives you access to the WAAAGH! Invasion cb against any of the target's de-jure kingdoms.\n During 2 years, hordes of Greenskins will flock to your banner. Not declaring war within two years cancels the invasion and has a heavy Prestige cost. You can only declare WAAAGHs against realms adjacent to yours.
I'ma krump dis weak boy boss on 'is head...
We'z da [From.Culture.GetName], and we be bossed by no stinkin' [Root.Culture.GetName]! STOMP HIM!
[Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName] Iz a squigg-lova 'an a runt, 'an he'z gunna get his 'ead smashed!
If there'z sum good scrappin' you'z can count on da boyz to fight wit ya...

Send in da boyz ta make da land green! Note that Greenskin colonization is inherently destructive, and it will destroy all holdings but the capital at the end of the process, which will become a Tribal holding if it isn't already.

Maybe dis 'ere boy deserves a reward....

 ----------------

 To grant titles to a new holder as a Greenskin you need to first tag the selected character through this decision, then right click on the title you wish to give away to complete the process before the assigned modifier tag runs out.

OI! Rememba? Yous gonna give dis ere git a propa reward....

----------------

  Once you've tagged a Greenskin through character decision, pick this decision to grant him this title.
OI! Boss! [Root.Location.GetName] looks kinda empty. Maybe we's should have da boyz place sum dung-huts in dis 'ere place?

Every Greenskin holds one of their twin gods, Gork and Mork, in higher esteem than the other, which usually causes constant arguments and conflict (as does everything else for them) over who's the strongest.
The Greenskins have left destruction in their wake on this province. With a little funding, you could call for an expedition to eliminate them entirely from the area.

Awakening to the world allows Slann to communicate directly with their subjects, without going through a Skink Priest first. In game terms, this means you are no longer in a regency.\n\nAwakening will cost 100 piety for every level of sleep.

The minds of the Slann are ever at risk of corruption and misdirection by the forces of Chaos. Ascending to a lighter level of contemplation will make it easier to completely rouse from your sleep, but you will also be more exposed to the forces of madness.

When the Lustrian jungle in a province gets out of hand, it is possible to try and get it back under control by burning and cutting the vegetation. But beware, for it is a dangerous task.\n\nYou will attempt to cut back the jungle in the province where your Steward is located. The chance of success depends on the Stewardship of the character you send.
Attempt to respectfully and kindly awake the Mage-Priest of your City-Temple to assist you in your war effort.
Awaken one of your slumbering ancestors from their eternal grave to do your bidding
Many Nehekharans resent their current status as undead, having being promised an eternal life as gods and now stuck in this tormented state by the wicked sorcery of Nagash.
Remove your mask, showing openly your horrifying and corrupted image.
Embrace the old faith of the dead.
As your prisoner, you can kill [Root.GetTitledFirstName], although, [Root.GetHerHis] standing could provoke a reaction from your vassals or the lords of nearby realms.

Though some rose with you, many of those who were your servants in life still remain buried in the tombs and under the sands of Nehekhara. You may awaken them, so that they may serve in death as well, and help improve your realm...
Ogres are known for their appetite and cannibalistic tendencies. Eat [Root.GetFirstName] to gain prestige and piety.

You can finance [Root.GetFirstName], one of the blaggards in your court, and grant [Root.GetHerHim] command of a fleet to plunder in your name. While not vassalized, [Root.GetSheHe] will plunder nearby lands and send the booty back to you. That is, assuming [Root.GetSheHe] likes you well enough...
The verminous mark of the Skaven still remains in this province. With a little funding you could call for an expedition to eliminate them entirely from the area.
Too dangerous to stand for a Clan that is not supported by the local Warlord, no-no.
Pay useless money to gain most precious warpstone and achieve your destiny!
What-what!?! Useless minions! Do you not know that my Clan is the greatest smartest most powerful in Skavendom? And that I'll have kill-killed whoever doesn't agree with me?
Consume the precious warpstone and gain the power to rule the world-world!

Your Leader is your Leader, but shouldn't you really be the one in charge? Surely you are smarter, stronger, better in any way than that idiot you call Master. Surely you have every right-right to take his place...
All your Breeders are belong to us!

You have a wide selection of Breeders, oh Great One! Pick one or a dozen for yourself? Breeders are stinky numb-dumb bloated filthy creatures, but you can use them to store many little ratlings inside their ugly belly and spawn a thousand good and powerful Skaven!
Borrowed 300¤ from the Knights of the White Wolf
Borrowed 300¤ from the Knights of Sigmar's Blood
Borrowed 300¤ from the Knights of the Blazing Sun
Borrowed 300¤ from the Knights of the Black Rose
Borrowed 300¤ from the Sisters of Sigmar
Borrowed 300¤ from the Order of the Eagle
Expelled the Knights of the White Wolf
Expelled the Knights of Sigmar's Blood
Expelled the Knights of the Blazing Sun
Expelled the Knights of the Black Rose
Expelled the Order of the Eagle
Borrow 300¤ from the Knights of the White Wolf

I can borrow money from the Knights of the White Wolf and pay back the same sum at any time. However, while I'm in their debt, the Grand Master can make various requests, like one of my sons joining their ranks.
Borrow 300¤ from the Knights of Sigmar's Blood

I can borrow money from the Knights of Sigmar's Blood and pay back the same sum at any time. However, while I'm in their debt, the Grand Master can make various requests, like one of my sons joining their ranks.
Borrow 300¤ from the Knights of the Blazing Sun

I can borrow money from the Knights of the Blazing Sun and pay back the same sum at any time. However, while I'm in their debt, the Grand Master can make various requests, like one of my sons joining their ranks.
Borrow 300¤ from the Knights of the Black Rose

I can borrow money from the Knights of the Black Rose and pay back the same sum at any time. However, while I'm in their debt, the Grand Master can make various requests, like one of my sons joining their ranks.

I can borrow money from the Knights Mariner and pay back the same sum at any time. However, while I'm in their debt, the Grand Master can make various requests, like one of my sons joining their ranks.
Borrow 300¤ from the Sisters of Sigmar

I can borrow money from the Sisters of Sigmar and pay back the same sum at any time. However, while I'm in their debt, the Grand Master can make various requests, like one of my sons joining their ranks.
Borrow 300¤ from the Order of the Eagle

I can borrow money from the Order of the Eagle and pay back the same sum at any time. However, while I'm in their debt, the Grand Master can make various requests, like one of my sons joining their ranks.
Expel the Knights of the White Wolf
I can drive  the Knights of the White Wolf from my realm and seize their castles. However, it is a very impious thing to do...
Expel the Knights of Sigmar's Blood
I can drive the Knights of Sigmar's Blood
column3: from my realm and seize their castles. However, it is a very impious thing to do...

column2: Expel the Knights of the Blazing Sun
I can drive the Knights of the Blazing Sun from my realm and seize their castles. However, it is a very impious thing to do...
Expel the Knights of the Black Rose
I can drive the Knights of the Black Rose from my realm and seize their castles. However, it is a very impious thing to do...
I can drive the Knights Mariner from my realm and seize their castles. However, it is a very impious thing to do...
I can drive the Sisters of Sigmar from my realm and seize their castles. However, it is a very impious thing to do...
Expel the Order of the Eagle
I can drive the Order of the Eagle from my realm and seize their castles. However, it is a very impious thing to do...
Donate 300¤ to the Knights of the White Wolf
I can donate money to the Knights of the White Wolf in exchange for [Player.Religion.GetPietyName] and lifelong respect from the priesthood.
Donate 300¤ to the Knights of Sigmar's Blood
I can donate money to the Knights of Sigmar's Blood in exchange for [Player.Religion.GetPietyName] and lifelong respect from the priesthood.
Donate 300¤ to the Knights of the Blazing Sun
I can donate money to the Knights of the Blazing Sun in exchange for [Player.Religion.GetPietyName] and lifelong respect from the priesthood.
Donate 300¤ the Knights of the Black Rose
I can donate money to the Knights of the Black Rose in exchange for [Player.Religion.GetPietyName] and lifelong respect from the priesthood.
I can donate money to the Knights Mariner in exchange for [Player.Religion.GetPietyName] and lifelong respect from the priesthood.
I can donate money to the Sisters of Sigmar in exchange for [Player.Religion.GetPietyName] and lifelong respect from the priesthood.
Donate 300¤ to the Order of the Eagle
I can donate money to the Order of the Eagle in exchange for [Player.Religion.GetPietyName] and lifelong respect from the priesthood.
Inspects the army, counting the number of troops that Elector Counts can provide state.
Head out on patrol. Who knows what's lurking?
Time to drop what you are doing and make way to your castle.
Travel the world to ferret out injustice and defeat the enemies of the Land and Lady.

The Everchosen, also known as the Lord of the End Times, is a mortal champion behind whom all the Chaos Gods unite. War and death, famine and plague follow this great warrior wherever they tread, and nature itself abhors their presence.
Grand Father Nurgle, I give you my body for life eternal!
Oh Prince of Pleasure, let me revel in your excess!
Lord of Slaughter, bring me more foes!
Master of Fate, show me the strands of fate so I might shape the flow of destiny...
Hold the biggest feast ever seen!
I shall take to the skies!
On the wings of a lion I ride!
Dis ere' beast will git me to da best fights!
I ascend to the heavens on the wings of the Ancients!
A mighty beast and companion to fight with me against my foes!
A mighty beast to fight with me against my foes!
Dis ere' beast will git me to da best fights!
A mighty beast to release against any who would dare stand before me!
This glorious chariot shall bring swift retribution to those who would dare oppose me!
Use this decision to place your slaves in provinces, or sell them
Show Courtiers That Can be Turned
Those weak in mind and body are so much more malleable...
Eternal life is so precious, not all deserve its gift...
I shall sire only one worthy of my legacy.
The powers of the warp flow through me!
The winds of Dhar bend to my will!
Cast Arnzipals Black Horror at Enemy
Beg Malekith and Morathi for a disciple of Dhar.
I unleash the tempest fury of the storms!
Feel the flames of the phoenix!
You do not deserve the power of magic...
Cast Doom and Darkness on Enemy
Cast Purple Sun of Xereus on Enemy
This character goes into seclusion, delving deep into the winds of magic...
Return from your studies early and end regency.
Holds at least one of the elector titles in the Empire
Once every spring, the Amazons disregard their laws about male contact and hold a feast in honor of the Snake-Goddess of fertility.

As a Lahmian Queen, you can send your daughters abroad to seduce individuals of note. If successful in ingratiating themselves into the local high society, they can use that position to manipulate their target into sending you troops or gold. It is not without expenses, however - to pull off the role of a newly arrived rich noblewoman requires money, and the more powerful the target is, the more money it will take to impress them.

As a Lahmian, you can go abroad to seduce individuals of note. If successful in ingratiating yourself into the local high society, you can use that position to manipulate your target into sending you troops or gold. It is not without expenses, however - to pull off the role of a newly arrived rich noblewoman requires money, and the more powerful the target is, the more money it will take to impress them.

You can recall your daughter to return home, but be aware that she simply cannot pack up and leave. It may take up to a year before she is able to dislodge herself from her current cover without her trail leading back to you and potentially damaging the sisterhood's interests.
Bring your lover to your court

If your lover is unlanded you can attempt to invite him to your court. This is particularly useful if he has claims on certain titles... Be aware that if he goes off with you he will be disinherited by his family, but you can still press his claims via war and install him as a Lahmian puppet in his family's lands to rule in the name of the Sisterhood. As soon as he arrives in your court you can turn him into a vampire, or keep him as a human minion, if you wish.
This character is currently on a mission to recruit suitably beautiful and intelligent women of high birth to the sisterhood. Do you wish to send a recall order?

You can send out either members of the sisterhood or males to recruit suitably beautiful and scheming women of high birth to the Lahmian cause. They will remain on mission until recalled, and will need some funds to finance this venture in proper style.
Only valid if option B was chosen at start-up
Take any and all artifacts of value in possession of [Root.GetFirstName].
Attempt to manipulate Hysh to heal the people from injuries and illness.
Use White Wind of Magic to banish the Daemon from the body of a person.
A character possessed by the Daemon must be in reach.
Attempt to cast Dark Magic spells.
Attempt to manipulate Aqushy, the Red Wind of Magic.
Performs a ritual of great power raising an undead legion.
Summons the Wind of Death which sucks the life from the the living in area.
Requires enormous magical power and hundreds of Human corpses. Province must be controlled by character.
Requires tremendous magical power. Will kill large amount of population - cannot be used in the same province twice. Province must be controlled by character.
Reveal yourself as a Chaos worshipper.
Reveal yourself as a Chaos worshipper.
Join the holy war against the Chaos forces that are trespassing in your lands.
Requires Chaos army trespassing in your lands.
Call for help against the forces of Chaos.
Sends a call for help to every ruler of the forces of Order.
Show all employment decisions available to this character.
Hide all employment decisions available to this character.
Promote a young statesmen to serve in your courts.
Persuade a young warrior to fight for your cause.
Invite a promising steward to court, to aid with matters of administration.
Call forth a spymaster from your rings to advise you.
Scour the land for a priest to join my court and advise me on religious matters.
A young noblewoman who has caught your eye makes her début at a formal ball.
A young scion who has caught your attention makes his début at court.
Awaken a Tomb King to rule over parts of your land in your stead.
Invite a Witch Hunter to your court to root out heretics and cultists.

If you want to enjoy [Root.GetFirstName]'s company to entertain yourself in your free time, you could make [Root.GetHerHim] your consort. Remember that releasing [Root.GetHerHim] from your dungeon might allow him to flee.
Take this character as your concubine.
Retire with your thralls for some sweet time.
Leave the solace of your retirement and return to lead your people.
Make of use of your toy however you see fit.
Try and make [Root.GetFirstName] to understand what are the nice things in life.
You've faced a particularly troublesome pregnancy. The next could be lethal. Maybe it would be best to abstain, rather than risk?
Make a ransom offer to all prisoners.
column3: Make a ransom offer to all prisoners.
column4: Make a ransom offer to all prisoners.
column6: Make a ransom offer to all prisoners.

column2: Removes "Hidden", "Stalwart", or "Left At Siege" from any of your dynasty members or spouses at your location.
Any prisoners ranked above Baron are transferred to your dungeons.
Wake your Slann for his wisdom and guidance.
Build a hospital in this province.
No, I don't need a dragon mount.

The dragons of Caledor are mostly sleeping, but the secrets of the old dragon tamers are not entirely lost. With a decade to spare, money, and enough prestige, it may be possible to convince a dragon to serve as your mount.
It has been ten years, and you have succeeded in waking a ancient dragon of Caledor and convincing it to serve as your mount. Let all know of your glory!
I thought the dragons were all sleeping!
Rumour reaches you that a mighty Dragon Prince has succeeded in waking and taming a mighty beast to serve as his mount in battle. Let the enemies of Caledor tremble...
Vampires have been known to use their innate necromantic powers to piece together monstrous creatures that would fly them into the night and upon their prey.
I've better things to spend my time on.
After months of hard work, the monster is finally ready. The shrieking abomination craves for the blood of your enemies and is ready to fly you wherever you wish.

A Knight as powerful as you are, deserves a mighty steed to go with [Root.GetHerHim]. You may embark in a short quest to find your very own Nightmare to ride, although it might keep you away for a while.
There it is, a dark and twisted form, gallopping through the somber clouds of a stormy night, your new steed. It is finally time to go back home.
Yes, I will train a mammoth.

,Great mammoths walk in northern tundras, where some tribes and Ogres hunt them for meat, skins and bones. But some hunt them for war. Capturing one alive and bending it to one's will is no easy task, but if succeeded, the tribe will have a warbeast that can crush buildings and break down the gates of strongholds.
It has been five years, and your Mammoth stands ready. It is a mighty beast towering over even the largest of your tribe, It will give you many advantages in battle.
Yes, I will build a war chariot.

Ever since their invention, chariots have been the chosen means of transport for the kings of Nehekhara. Upon awakening from their deathly slumbers, Tomb Kings have continued to lead their armies to war from atop these ancient machines.

It has been five years, and your chariot is ready. Not only does your chariot have an armoured carriage, to protect you from harm, it also provides you with an elevated platform. This grants you a superior view of the battlefield, enabling you to direct your own troops to inflict the most damage.

There is no creature more important to the Kislevites than the bear. He is more than just the symbol of the land, a god, and his image is more than just a rallying figure for armies and proud citizens. The bear shares his life with the people of the oblast and shares their struggles. When winters are harsh, he goes hungry just as they do. When spring comes again, he takes his young to the river to play just as they do. In summers bloom, he trains his young to hunt, and he hunts as well as any man.

Cold Ones are rapacious predators, fuelled by a savage blood-lust that drives them to attack any warm-blooded creature that comes near. Cold Ones hunt in packs, and are perfectly capable of bringing down creatures many times their own size. They are found in many places but are most commonly seen on the continent known as the New World that lies just to the west of Ulthuan. Their habitats range from the tunnels and mountains under Hag Graef in the realms of the Dark Elves, all the way, hundreds of miles south, to the Lustrian jungles that are home to the Lizardmen.

Giant Spiders are deadly hunters, easily capable of ensnaring and overwhelming a fully-grown man. Their toxic venom is deadly to all but the hardiest victim, and few survive for long once bitten. Some particularly old and powerful giant spiders have been known to grow as large as a house, and forest goblin tribes revere these ancient beasts and even ride them to war. Giant spiders can be part of a larger brood, often led by a spider queen, but they are often encountered singly or in small numbers.

Great mammoths roam the northern tundras, where some Norscan and Ogre tribes hunt them for meat, skins and bones. But some hunt them for war. Capturing one alive and bending it to one's will is no easy task, but if succeeded, the tribe will have a warbeast that can crush buildings and break down the gates of strongholds. Mammoths can be used to break down enemy troops as well.

Only the greatest and most esteemed warriors were given the rights to ride these ancient warmachines to battle. Their advance is heralded by a cloud of dust thrown high into the air as they drive across the land.
